checks.0: Devices with present configuration register other than 0x0
checks.20: Devices with configuration register value equal to 0x0. The device will not load an OS or Configuration after reboot.

descriptions.general: Boot configuration register verification.

checks.0: Interfaces that are distributing power over ethernet and are operational (ON).
checks.10: Interfaces that are capable of distributing power over ethernet and are not operational (OFF).
checks.20: Interfaces that are capable of distributing power over ethernet and have faulty operational status (FAULT, ERROR).

descriptions.general: Detects operational state of interfaces that are capable of distributing power over Ethernet (PoE).

checks.10: Active FHRP gateways that are not aligned with the Spanning-Tree Protocol Root bridge.

descriptions.general: Identifies active First Hop Redundancy Protocol (FHRP) gateways that are not aligned with the Spanning-Tree Protocol (STP) Root bridge.

name: STP Root And FHRP Active Mismatch

descriptions.general: Check the status of the MLAG Pairs across the network infrastructure.

checks.0: Primary and Secondary are UP
checks.20: Either primary or backup is not UP
checks.30: Both Pairs are not UP

checks.0: Devices with 'Input Errors Impact' value equal to zero.
checks.10: Devices with 'Input Errors Impact' value between 1 and 5.
checks.20: Devices with 'Input Errors Impact' value between 5 and 10.
checks.30: Devices with 'Input Errors Impact' value greater than 10.

descriptions.general: Verifies impact value for input errors per network device.
Checks Cisco VPC status across the network infrastructure.

checks.0: VPC Status is UP
checks.10: Role is not primary nor secondary
checks.30: VPC Status is not UP

checks.0: IP subnets with two or more gateways and one virtual gateway with active endpoints or IP subnets with no active endpoints.
checks.10: IP subnets with zero virtual gateways or IP subnets with one physical gateway with less than 20 active endpoints.
checks.20: IP subnets with two or more virtual gateways or IP subnets with no virtual gateway with more than 20 active endpoints.

descriptions.general: Verifies gateways with virtual gateways alignment combined with the number of detected endpoints for each subnet.

checks.0: Network devices with equal number of configured sources and reachable sources.
checks.10: Network devices with at least 1 configured source and 1 reachable source.
checks.20: Network devices with no configured source and no reachable source.
checks.30: Network devices with at least 1 configured source and no reachable source.

descriptions.general: Verifies reachable Network Time Protocol (NTP) sources with comparison to configured sources.

checks.0: Devices memory utilization below 50%.
checks.10: Device memory utilization between 50% and 70%.
checks.20: Device memory utilization between 70% and 85%.
checks.30: Device memory utilization greater than 85%

descriptions.general: Memory utilization verification according to thresholds.

checks.0: Devices with remote syslog server configuration that do not have 'DEBUG' enabled.
checks.20: Devices with remote syslog server configuration that have 'DEBUG' enabled.

descriptions.general: Verifies remote system logging severity for network devices.

checks.0: Aggregated interfaces with output balancing variance lower than 500.
checks.10: Aggregated interfaces with output balancing variance higher than 500 and Rate below 30Mbps.
checks.20: Aggregated interfaces with output balancing variance higher than 500 and Rate above 30Mbps.
checks.30: Aggregated interfaces with output balancing variance greater than 500 and Rate above 1000Mbps.

descriptions.general: Verifies output balancing variance for aggregated interfaces.

checks.0: Network devices with saved running configuration
checks.10: Devices where check was not performed if the configuration was saved
checks.20: Network devices with unsaved configuration, having different running and startup configurations.
checks.30: Network devices with status 'CHANGED'.

descriptions.general: Verifies saved configuration consistency for network devices.
Ensures the VSL interfaces are correctly bundled.

checks.0: All VSL ports are bundled
checks.20: At least one VSL port is not bundled

descriptions.general: Detects infrastructure devices that are no longer maintained by the vendor.

checks.0: Part numbers which have announced End of Support date or equivalent, but have yet to pass it.
checks.20: Part numbers which have announced End of Maintenance date or equivalent which has passed

checks.0: Interfaces with 'Bidirectional Loss Impact' value equal to zero.
checks.10: Interfaces with 'Bidirectional Loss Impact' value between 1 and 5.
checks.20: Interfaces with 'Bidirectional Loss Impact' value between 5 and 10.
checks.30: Interfaces with 'Bidirectional Loss Impact' value greater than 10.

descriptions.general: Verifies impact value for bidirectional transfer data rates on interfaces.

checks.0: QoS priority classes without any drops detected.
checks.20: QoS priority classes with drops detected.

descriptions.general: Detects drops on Quality of Service (QoS) Priority classes operating in the network.

checks.0: Records with any type of Authentication method except 'none' or 'unspecified'.
checks.20: Records with the type of Authentication method 'none' or 'unspecified'.

descriptions.general: Verifies the type of Authentication, authorization and accounting (AAA) Primary Authentication Method.
Verifies the all pseudowire circuit's state.

checks.0: Pseudowire state is UP
checks.10: Pseudowire state is DOWN

descriptions.general: Verifies the virtual private wire service (VPWS) circuit state

checks.0: VPWS circuit's state is UP
checks.10: VPWS circuit's state is DOWN

checks.0: Devices with Input Drops Impact' value equal to zero.
checks.10: Devices with 'Input Drops Impact' value between 1 and 5.
checks.20: Devices with 'Input Drops Impact' value between 5 and 10.
checks.30: Devices with 'Input Drops Impact' value greater than 10.

descriptions.general: Verifies impact value for input drops per network device.
The verification of authentication of IPSec gateways.

checks.0: IPSec gateways with strong authentication
checks.20: IPSec gateways with weak authentication

descriptions.general: Checks the state is neither active nor standby hot

checks.0: Active or Standby Hot
checks.20: Unexpected State

checks.0: Aggregated interfaces with input balancing variance lower than 500.
checks.10: Aggregated interfaces with input balancing variance higher than 500 and Rate below 30Mbps.
checks.20: Aggregated interfaces with input balancing variance higher than 500 and Rate above 30Mbps.
checks.30: Aggregated interfaces with input balancing variance greater than 500 and Rate above 1000Mbps.

descriptions.general: Verifies input balancing variance value for aggregated interfaces.

checks.0: Access points with less than 50 clients connected.
checks.10: Access points with within 50 and 80 clients connected.
checks.20: Access points with within 80 and 100 clients connected.
checks.30: Access points with more than 100 clients connected.

descriptions.general: Verifies the number of clients for each access point (AP) against predefined thresholds.

checks.10: Links with missing duplex information.
checks.20: Links with mismatched duplex.

descriptions.general: Detects mismatched or missing duplex information.

checks.0: Devices with 'Bidirectional Loss Impact' value equal to zero.
checks.10: Devices with 'Bidirectional Loss Impact' value between 1 and 5.
checks.20: Devices with 'Bidirectional Loss Impact' value between 5 and 10.
checks.30: Devices with 'Bidirectional Loss Impact' value greater than 10.

descriptions.general: Verifies impact value for bidirectional transfer data rates per network device.

checks.0: LDP sessions with uptime greater than one month.
checks.10: LDP sessions with uptime between one month and one week.
checks.20: LDP sessions with uptime between one week and one day.
checks.30: LDP sessions with uptime less than 24 hours.

descriptions.general: Verifies Label Distribution Protocol (LDP) session age time against predefined compliance thresholds.
Verifies state of control and fabric links in the cluster.

checks.0: Control or Fabric links that are UP.
checks.20: Control or Fabric links that are not UP.

descriptions.general: Verifies protocol type for the unmanaged neighbor.

checks.0: Unmanaged neighbors detected with BGP protocol.
checks.20: Unmanaged neighbors detected with interior gateway protocols.
checks.30: Unmanaged neighbors detected with discovery protocols.

descriptions.general: Detects discovery protocol loops.

checks.0: Discovery protocol neighbors with no loop detected.
checks.20: Local Hostname equals the Remote Neighbor column.
checks.30: Local Hostname and Interfaces match remote Neighbor and Interface.

descriptions.general: The overall status of the IPSec gateways.

checks.0: IPSec gateways that are in UP status.
checks.30: IPSec gateways that are in DOWN status.

descriptions.general: Verifies the total number of dropped packets compared to total packets.

checks.0: Represents devices with enabled DHCP Snooping without dropped packets detected.
checks.20: Represents devices with enabled DHCP Snooping with dropped packets detected.

checks.0: OSPFv3 enabled interfaces with one or more neighbors detected.
checks.10: OSPFv3 enabled interfaces with zero neighbors detected.

descriptions.general: Verifies the number of Open Shortest Path First version 3 (OSPFv3) sessions for OSPFv3 enabled interfaces.

checks.0: Devices with local syslog server configuration that do not have 'DEBUG' enabled.
checks.20: Devices with local syslog server configuration that have 'DEBUG' enabled.

descriptions.general: Verifies local system logging severity for network devices.
Verifies Open Shortest Path First version 3 (OSPF) session age time against predefined compliance thresholds.

checks.0: OSPFv3 sessions with uptime greater than one month.
checks.10: OSPFv3 sessions with uptime between one month and one week.
checks.20: OSPFv3 sessions with uptime between one week and one day.
checks.30: OSPFv3 sessions with uptime less than 24 hours.

descriptions.general: Detecting Other errors increase between two latest snapshots.

checks.0: MRoutes without any detected errors per seconds compared to previous discovery records. (TTL, Empty OIL, Encap, Other)
checks.20: MRoutes with detected errors per seconds compared to previous discovery records. (TTL, Empty OIL, Encap, Other)

checks.0: Records with any type of Authorization method except 'none' or 'unspecified'.
checks.20: Records with the type of Authorization method 'none' or 'unspecified'.

descriptions.general: Verifies the type of Authentication, authorization and accounting (AAA) Primary Authorization Method.

checks.0: Devices with uptime longer than 1 week and less than 3 years
checks.10: Devices running for more than 3 years
checks.20: Devices with uptime less than one week
checks.30: Devices with uptime less than one day

descriptions.general: Device uptime verification. Verifies that device continuous running time is within the expected thresholds.

checks.20: Network devices with mismatched information between Spanning-Tree Protocol (STP) and discovery protocols (CDP/LLDP).

descriptions.general: Detects mismatch between Spanning-Tree Protocol (STP) and Cisco Discovery Protocol (CDP) or Link-Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) information.
Verifies the number of Enhanced Interior Gateway Routing Protocol (EIGRP) sessions for EIGRP interfaces.

checks.0: EIGRP interfaces with one or more neighbors detected.
checks.10: EIGRP interfaces with zero neighbors detected.

checks.0: VNI state is up
checks.20: VNI  is admin down

checks.0: SNMP communities that have not been left with default name.
checks.20: SNMP communities that are left with default name 'PUBLIC' or 'PRIVATE'.

descriptions.general: Verifies Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) communities configuration for network devices.
Verifies the Circuit Cross-Connect (CCC) circuit state.

checks.0: CCC circuit's state is UP
checks.10: CCC circuit's state is UP

descriptions.general: Verifies the expiration time for DHCP bindings. Most of the implementations try to renew a leased IP address after reaching half of the timeout.

checks.0: Represents DHCP binding session with session expiration time greater than 300 seconds.
checks.10: Represents DHCP binding session with session expiration time within 300 and 180 seconds, or unknown.
checks.20: Represents DHCP binding session with session expiration time within 180 and 60 seconds.
checks.30: Represents DHCP binding session with session expiration time less than 60 seconds.

checks.0: NTP sources with Round Trip Time lower than 50ms.
checks.10: NTP sources with Round Trip Time value within 50-100ms.
checks.20: NTP sources with Round Trip Time value within 100-500ms.
checks.30: NTP sources with Round Trip Time value above 500ms.

descriptions.general: Verifies the Round Trip Time (RTT) value for Network Time Protocol (NTP) sources.
Device uptime verification. Verifies that the stack member's continuous running time is within the expected thresholds.

checks.0: Stack member with uptime longer than 1 week and less than 3 years
checks.10: Stack members running for more than 3 years
checks.20: Stack member with uptime less than one week
checks.30: Stack members with uptime less than one day

descriptions.general: SDWAN Site uptime verification.

checks.0: Sites with uptime longer than 1 week and less than 3 years
checks.10: Sites running for more than 1 year
checks.20: Sites with uptime less than one week
checks.30: Sites with uptime less than one day

checks.0: Media Access Control records with an expected dynamic sources (learn, dynamic, evpn, d, dl, dlr).
checks.10: Media Access Control records from unexpected source.
checks.20: Media Access Control records with source 'static' or 'self'.

descriptions.general: Identifies Media Access Control (MAC) address source.

checks.0: Classes carrying Expedited Forwarding traffic with drop rate equal to 0
checks.20: Classes carrying Expedited Forwarding traffic with drop rate greater than 0

descriptions.general: QoS Expedited Forwarding classes are usually carrying critical traffic where drops are highly unwanted and can cause service degradation, signifying under-provisioning or other issues. Verification detects the drop rate within the Expedited Forwarding classes.

checks.0: Devices with at least one configured SNMP user and with at least one configured SNMP community.
checks.10: Devices with at least one configured SNMP user or with at least one configured SNMP community.
checks.20: Devices with no SNMP user and no SNMP community configured.

descriptions.general: Verifies Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) configuration for network devices.

checks.0: The total number of MAC addresses that have assigned IP Address information.
checks.10: The total number of MAC addresses that have not assigned any IP Address information.

descriptions.general: Verifies if the IP address is present for each MAC addresses information.

checks.0: OSPF sessions with uptime greater than one month.
checks.10: OSPF sessions with uptime between one month and one week.
checks.20: OSPF sessions with uptime between one week and one day.
checks.30: OSPF sessions with uptime less than 24 hours.

descriptions.general: Verifies Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) session age time against predefined compliance thresholds.
